#Text=Gay Talese on the state of journalism , Iraq and his life
#Text=Saturday , October 27 , 2007
#Text=Gay Talese wants to go to Iraq . "

column3:

#Text=It so happens there is someone that 's working on such a thing right now for me ,  the 75-year-old legendary journalist and author told David Shankbone .

#Text=In the 70th anniversary issue of Esquire in October 2003 , the editors declared the piece the  Best Story Esquire Ever Published . "

column1: #Text=Talese helped create and define a new style of literary reporting called New Journalism .
#Text=Talese himself told National Public Radio he rejects this label (
#Text=" The term new journalism became very fashionable on college campuses in the 1970s and some of its practitioners tended to be a little loose with the facts .

#Text= It 's not like we should lament the passing of some noble dynasty ! " — to Rupert Murdoch , but he is bothered by how the press supported and sold the Iraq War to the American people .

column1: #Text=" The press in Washington got us into this war as much as the people that are controlling it , " said Talese .
#Text=" They took information that was second-hand information , and they went along with it . "

#Text=He wants to see the Washington press corp disbanded and sent around the country to get back in touch with the people it covers ; that the press should not be so focused on -- and in bed with -- the federal government .
#Text=Augusten Burroughs once said that writers are experience junkies , and Talese fits the bill .

#Text=Talese -- who has been married to Nan Talese ( she edited James Frey 's Million Little Piece ) for fifty years -- can be found at baseball games in Cuba or the gay bars of Beijing , wanting to see humanity in all its experience .
#Text=Below is Wikinews reporter David Shankbone 's interview with Gay Talese .
#Text=On Gay Talese
#Text=Does it bother you that your name has come to mean ' homosexual ' ?
#Text=No , it does n't bother me at all !
#Text=I 've always been called that , I had bylines in high school .
#Text=I started getting bylines when I was in high school and I wrote for the Ocean City Sentinel .
#Text=I was Gay Talese .
#Text=I even had a column when I went to college in Alabama , it was called Sports Gay-zing - I was the sports editor for the college paper .
